markdownRemark.html: The Cathedral of Seville is a Roman Catholic cathedral and was the most visited monument in the city of Seville in 2018. It was registered in 1987 by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site, along with the adjoining Alcázar palace complex and the General Archive of the Indies.

frontmatter.title: Cathedral & Giralda
frontmatter.description: Cathedral & Giralda - The Cathedral of Seville is a Roman Catholic cathedral and was the most visited monument in the city of Seville in 2018. It was registered in 1987 by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site, along with the adjoining Alcázar palace complex and the General Archive of the Indies.
frontmatter.address: Av. de la Constitución, s/n, 41004 Sevilla
frontmatter.price: General admission 9.00 euro, Reduced admission 4.00 euro, Free admission for Natives or residents in the Diocese of Seville, Unemployed, Disabled and Children until 14 years old.
tags: Top things to do in Seville
